mechanoreception.notes: As marine bivalves, Hiatellidae likely possess mechanoreceptors to detect water movement and substrate vibrations. This is inferred, as specific studies on Hiatellidae mechanoreception are unavailable.

chemoreception.notes: Hiatellidae likely use chemoreceptors to detect food and other chemical cues in the marine environment. This is inferred, as specific studies on Hiatellidae chemoreception are unavailable.

vision.notes: Vision is generally absent in bivalves. Some species may have light-sensitive cells.
